event.name: OnActivate
event.help: Process a wxEVT_ACTIVATE event.

event.name: OnActivateApp
event.help: Process a wxEVT_ACTIVATE_APP event.

event.name: OnClose
event.help: Process a close event.

event.name: OnHibernate
event.help: Process a hibernate event, supplying the member function. This event applies to wxApp only, and only on Windows SmartPhone and PocketPC. It is generated when the system is low on memory; the application should free up as much memory as possible, and restore full working state when it receives a wxEVT_ACTIVATE or wxEVT_ACTIVATE_APP event.

event.name: OnIconize
event.help: Process a wxEVT_ICONIZE event. Only available for the wxMSW, wxGTK ports.

event.name: OnMaximize
event.help: Process a wxEVT_ICONIZE event. Currently this event is only generated in wxMSW, wxGTK and wxOSX/Cocoa ports.

event.name: OnShow
event.help: Process a wxEVT_SHOW event. Only available for the wxMSW, wxGTK ports.

event.name: OnMove
event.help: Process a wxEVT_MOVE event, which is generated when a window is moved.

event.name: OnMoving
event.help: Process a wxEVT_MOVING event, which is generated while the user is moving the window. These events are currently only generated by wxMSW port.

event.name: OnMoveStart
event.help: Process a wxEVT_MOVE_START event, which is generated when the user starts to move or size a window. These events are currently only generated by wxMSW port.

event.name: OnMoveEnd
event.help: Process a wxEVT_MOVE_END event, which is generated when the user stops moving or sizing a window. These events are currently only generated by wxMSW port.

event.name: OnIdle
event.help: Process a wxEVT_IDLE event.

event.name: OnAuiPaneButton
event.help: Event is emitted under AUI-managed form only.

event.name: OnAuiPaneClose
event.help: Event is emitted under AUI-managed form only.

event.name: OnAuiPaneMaximize
event.help: Event is emitted under AUI-managed form only.

event.name: OnAuiPaneRestore
event.help: Event is emitted under AUI-managed form only.

event.name: OnAuiPaneActivated
event.help: Event is emitted under AUI-managed form only.

event.name: OnAuiRender
event.help: Event is emitted under AUI-managed form only.

option.name: wxFRAME_EX_CONTEXTHELP
option.help: Under Windows, puts a query button on the caption. When pressed, Windows will go into a context-sensitive help mode and wxWidgets will send a wxEVT_HELP event if the user clicked on an application window. You cannot use this style together with wxMAXIMIZE_BOX or wxMINIMIZE_BOX, so you should use wxDEFAULT_FRAME_STYLE &&~ (wxMINIMIZE_BOX | wxMAXIMIZE_BOX) for the frames having this style (the dialogs don't have a minimize or a maximize box by default). Note: The Project's "help_provider" property must be set for context-sensitive help to work.

option.name: wxFRAME_EX_METAL
option.help: On Mac OS X, frames with this style will be shown with a metallic look. This is an extra style.

property.name: center
property.help: Centers the dialog box on the display in the chosen direction.

property.name: two_step_creation
property.help: Add constructor and method for two-step creation. This requires the base class to support two-step creation.

property.name: xrc_skip_sizer
property.help: For XRC Only. Do not generate the first sizer if there is only one child.

property.name: event_handler
property.help: For C++ Only. The way how to declare and implement event handlers.

property.name: aui_managed
property.help: Manage this frame by AUI manager.

property.name: aui_manager_style
property.help: Configure AUI manager.

property.name: two_step_creation
property.help: Add constructor and method for two-step creation. This requires the base class to support two-step creation.

property.name: event_handler
property.help: For C++ Only. The way how to declare and implement event handlers.

event.name: OnInitDialog
event.help: Process a wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG event. A wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG is sent as a dialog or panel is being initialised.

property.name: aui_managed
property.help: Manage this panel by AUI manager.

property.name: aui_manager_style
property.help: Configure AUI manager.

option.name: wxDIALOG_EX_CONTEXTHELP
option.help: Under Windows, puts a query button on the caption. When pressed, Windows will go into a context-sensitive help mode and wxWidgets will send a wxEVT_HELP event if the user clicked on an application window. Note: The Project's "help_provider" property must be set for context-sensitive help to work.

option.name: wxDIALOG_EX_METAL
option.help: On Mac OS X, frames with this style will be shown with a metallic look. This is an extra style.

property.name: center
property.help: Centers the dialog box on the display in the chosen direction.

property.name: two_step_creation
property.help: Add constructor and method for two-step creation. This requires the base class to support two-step creation.

property.name: event_handler
property.help: For C++ Only. The way how to declare and implement event handlers.

event.name: OnInitDialog
event.help: Process a wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG event. A wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG is sent as a dialog or panel is being initialized.

property.name: aui_managed
property.help: Manage this dialog by AUI manager.

property.name: aui_manager_style
property.help: Configure AUI manager.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: Bitmap to display on the left side of the wizard (default: none).

option.name: wxWIZARD_EX_HELPBUTTON
option.help: Shows a Help button using wxID_HELP.

property.name: center
property.help: Centers the dialog box on the display in the chosen direction.

property.name: two_step_creation
property.help: Add constructor and method for two-step creation. This requires the base class to support two-step creation.

property.name: event_handler
property.help: For C++ Only. The way how to declare and implement event handlers.

event.name: OnInitDialog
event.help: Process a wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG event. A wxEVT_INIT_DIALOG is sent as a dialog or panel is being initialized.

event.name: OnWizardPageChanged
event.help: The page has just been changed (this event cannot be vetoed).

event.name: OnWizardPageChanging
event.help: The page is being changed (this event can be vetoed).

event.name: OnWizardBeforePageChanged
event.help: Called after Next is clicked but before GetNext is called. Unlike EVT_WIZARD_CHANGING, the handler for this function can change state that might affect the return value of GetNext. This event can be vetoed.

event.name: OnWizardPageShown
event.help: The page was shown and laid out (this event cannot be vetoed).

event.name: OnWizardCancel
event.help: The user attempted to cancel the wizard (this event may also be vetoed).

event.name: OnWizardHelp
event.help: The wizard help button was pressed.

event.name: OnWizardFinished
event.help: The wizard finished button was pressed.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: Page-specific bitmap (default: none).

option.name: wxMB_DOCKABLE
option.help: Allows the menu bar to be detached (wxGTK only).

property.name: bitmapsize
property.help: Default size of each tool bitmap. The default bitmap size is 16 by 15 pixels.

property.name: margins
property.help: Values to be used as margins for the toolbar.

property.name: packing
property.help: Value used for spacing tools. Remarks: The packing is used for spacing in the vertical direction if the toolbar is horizontal, and for spacing in the horizontal direction if the toolbar is vertical.

property.name: separation
property.help: The default separator size. Remarks: This is the size between each toolbar tool.
